result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A Eckstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
1:11 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Roeth has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Roeth.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-90 days of county jail.
-Court grants the defendant huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Sentence is to commence immediately.

-Court grants the defendant 55 days of sentence credit.

-Court orders the court costs of $443 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court adjourned at 1:18 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 3, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from Atty Jon Wilsnack - has no objection to amending the sentence to being applied to 2016CM26 instead of 2016CM24. (VIA FAX)
from Circuit Court to counsel dated April 13, 2016 in regards to the sentence on 2016CM24 & 2016CM26.  Counsel have 10 days to respond.

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

11:22 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2015CM279 and count 1 on 2016CM26 and 2016CM24 will be dismissed and read-in and defense is free to argue.  State concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 on 2015CM279 as charged & count 1 on 2016CM24 as charged.  Court ordes 2016CM26 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

*2015CM279 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Absolute sobriety.
-DNA sample

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 2 days on 2015CM279.

*2016CM24 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Absolute sobriety.
-DNA sample

2016CM24 - Court grants the defendant sentence credit of:  sentence credit from 01/26/ 2016 to today.


Court adjourned at 11:35 a.m.

9:11 A.M.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation - Bond was set.  Court orders bond to continue.  Court will set for Status Hearing on February 9, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:14 a.m.

No Contact with Dorthy A; Michelle A and Ed A.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant may go to the residence of the victim to obtain his/her personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.
